item.title: Should Bitcoin Exchange Bitsquare Adopt Reputation System?
item.description:
Should Bitcoin Exchange Bitsquare Adopt Reputation System?

Despite calls to adopt a decentralised reputation system on its platform, Bitsquare says it will not rely on it even though it is typically used to establish the trustworthiness of users in a network. Some Redditers, have asked for the system to be included as a feature on the platform.

item.title: Criminals Target Hospitals Through New Locky Ransomware Campaign
item.description:
Criminals Target Hospitals Through New Locky Ransomware Campaign

A new wave of ransomware attacks against hospital has begun. Internet criminals are distributing Locky ransomware on a vast scale, mostly in the form of phishing campaigns directed at the healthcare sector. The method of distribution is a macro-enabled Office 2007 Word document containing the malicious payload.

item.title: The Blush Family's Bitcoin Bus Tour: Dash Across America
item.description:
The Blush Family's Bitcoin Bus Tour: Dash Across America

A family of four have decided to test the limits of cryptocurrencies by dashing across America in their Bitcoin Bus, spending only cryptocurrency along the way. John Bush, Catherine Bleish, their two children, and their two dogs have endeavored to take on the challenge of traveling across the U.S.

item.title: California Lawmaker: Bitcoin Thefts Show Industry Regulation Needed - CoinDesk
item.description:
California Lawmaker: Bitcoin Thefts Show Industry Regulation Needed - CoinDesk

The state assemblyman behind efforts to regulate digital currency businesses in California cited the $65m hack of Bitfinex this week as evidence of the need for tighter industry controls. In a statement issued following his state's decision to temporarily shelve new rulemakings this year, he said that more time was needed to strike a balance between giving virtual currency businesses a firm foundation and ensuring consumers are protected.

item.title: CoinsBank Creates Environment For Mainstream Adoption Of The Blockchain
item.description:
CoinsBank Creates Environment For Mainstream Adoption Of The Blockchain

Originally known as Bit-X, CoinsBank is set for its first Blockchain Party, which will be held on October 6 - 9 2016 in Belek, Turkey. Speaking to Cointelegraph, the CEO at CoinsBank Exchange LP, Ronny Boesing describes the event as a platform which is designed to connect people with the aim of changing the world with Blockchain technology.

item.title: In the Bitcoin Era, Ransomware Attacks Surge
item.description:
In the Bitcoin Era, Ransomware Attacks Surge

One evening in April, Dave Winston stood in a convenience store in suburban Charlotte, N.C., uneasily shoving $20 bills into a slim automated-teller machine unlike any he had ever seen. He was buying bitcoin, a digital currency unknown to him a few hours earlier, before hackers took over his computer.

item.title: Magic Internet Money is Finally a Reality - Web3.0 is Here
item.description:
Magic Internet Money is Finally a Reality - Web3.0 is Here

The coolest thing on earth no one knows about has finally turned into reality a long-held dream in the digital currency space - the Facebook like button where you just click. MetaMask, a spoke of Consensys, has launched a Chrome plugin which on the surface looks too simple, even for my grandma.

item.title: Ethereum Classic Community Navigates a Distinct Path to the Future
item.description:
Ethereum Classic Community Navigates a Distinct Path to the Future

Ethereum Classic started off as what is perhaps best described as a protest movement, opposing a (perceived) bailout of Ethereum's leaderless investment venture, The DAO. But the brand new cryptocurrency, which is actually the continuation of the pre-hard forked Ethereum chain, has since surprised many.

item.title: FinTech Startup Says Law Enforcement Is Ramping Up Ransomware Arrests
item.description:
FinTech Startup Says Law Enforcement Is Ramping Up Ransomware Arrests

Chainalysis has stated that ransomware arrests will soon take place targeting cyber criminals behind ransomware attacks. Over the past six months, ransomware attacks have become an issue to government, business and healthcare organizations. In January, CCN reported that three banks and a pharmaceutical company in India had been targeted by a ransomware scheme with the ransom demand in bitcoins.

item.title: Ethereum Classic is Starting to Mobilize - CoinDesk
item.description:
Ethereum Classic is Starting to Mobilize - CoinDesk

Ethereum's original blockchain just won't die. The result of a hard fork of the ethereum network in July, the blockchain has not only survived, but it's evolving into a competing version of the decentralized application platform. Now, supporters of the platform are beginning to mobilize.
